comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: The pilot: WSSEWOLOD ABRAMOVITCH 1890-1913. Here is an interesting quote: " on the 24th of April, 1913, the talented pilot and inventor perished 'cause of princess Shakhovskaya's fault, during a dual flight with independent controls. Shakhovskaya herself remained uninjured." Could this have been right before his final flight?

comment.author: 95707111@N00
comment._content:
Princess Shakhovskaya was one of the first Russian women-pilots, the correct spelling of her name in Russian is Евгения Михайловна Шаховская (Evgenia Mikhailovna Shakhovskaya) 
I found the same information as Cotinis, but from a Russian historical source, though the date is different (it's April 11), because Russia lived according to Julian calender up till 1918.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: cotinis and On my way to Heaven: Thanks for the very interesting information on these two Russian aviators.  We will add it to the source data and reload the description.
